008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.ij.overlay;
010
011import java.awt.BasicStroke;
012import java.awt.Color;
013
014import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
015
016/**
017 * This is basically a mirror class of {@link BasicStroke} adding stroke and
018 * fill colors. Instances of this class are cloneable and mutable, setters for
019 * all fields are provided, i.e., strokes can be easily customized. Use
020 * {@link #getBasicStroke()} to convert to an AWT {@link BasicStroke} instance.
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 * @version 2021/10/26
024 */
025public class ColoredStroke implements Cloneable {       // TODO: simplify API
026        
027        public static final Color DefaultStrokeColor = Color.black;
028        public static final Color DefaultFillColor = null;
029        
030        private float lineWidth;
031        private int endCap;
032        private int lineJoin; 
033        private float miterLimit;
034        private float[] dashArray;
035        private float dashPhase;
036        private Color strokeColor;
037        private Color fillColor;
038        
039        public ColoredStroke() {
040                this(new BasicStroke());
041        }
042        
043        public ColoredStroke(BasicStroke bs) {
044                this(
045                        bs.getLineWidth(),
046                        bs.getEndCap(),
047                        bs.getLineJoin(),
048                        bs.getMiterLimit(),
049                        bs.getDashArray(),
050                        bs.getDashPhase(),
051                        DefaultStrokeColor,
052                        DefaultFillColor);
053        }
054        
055        public ColoredStroke(double lineWidth, int endCap, int lineJoin, 
056                        double miterLimit, float[] dashArray, double dashPhase,
057                        Color strokeColor, Color fillColor) {
058                this.lineWidth = (float) lineWidth;
059                this.endCap = endCap;
060                this.lineJoin =  lineJoin;
061                this.miterLimit = (float) miterLimit;
062                this.dashArray = dashArray;
063                this.dashPhase = (float) dashPhase;
064                this.strokeColor = strokeColor;
065                this.fillColor = fillColor;
066        }
067        
068        // convenience constructors 
069        
070        public ColoredStroke(double lineWidth, Color strokeColor, double dashLength) {
071                this();
072                this.setLineWidth(lineWidth);
073                this.setStrokeColor(strokeColor);
074                if (dashLength > 0) {
075                        this.setDash(dashLength);
076                }
077        }
078        
079        public ColoredStroke(double lineWidth, Color strokeColor) {
080                this();
081                this.setLineWidth(lineWidth);
082                this.setStrokeColor(strokeColor);
083        }
084        
085        public ColoredStroke(double lineWidth, Color strokeColor, Color fillColor) {
086                this();
087                this.setLineWidth(lineWidth);
088                this.setStrokeColor(strokeColor);
089                this.setFillColor(fillColor);
090        }
091        
092        @Override
093        public ColoredStroke clone() {
094                return new ColoredStroke(lineWidth, endCap, lineJoin, 
095                        miterLimit, dashArray, dashPhase, strokeColor, fillColor);
096        }
097
098        // -------------------------------------------------------
099        
100        public void setLineWidth(double lineWidth) {
101                this.lineWidth = (float) lineWidth;
102        }
103
104        public void setEndCap(int endCap) {
105                this.endCap = endCap;
106        }
107
108        public void setLineJoin(int lineJoin) {
109                this.lineJoin = lineJoin;
110        }
111
112        public void setMiterLimit(double miterLimit) {
113                this.miterLimit = (float) miterLimit;
114        }
115
116        public void setDashArray(float[] dashArray) {
117                this.dashArray = dashArray;
118        }
119
120        public void setDashPhase(double dashPhase) {
121                this.dashPhase = (float) dashPhase;
122        }
123
124        public void setStrokeColor(Color strokeColor) {
125                this.strokeColor = strokeColor;
126        }
127
128        public void setFillColor(Color fillColor) {
129                this.fillColor = fillColor;
130        }
131        
132        // -------------------------------------------------------------
133        
134        /**
135         * Convenience method to set (unset) the dash pattern
136         * Usage examples:
137         * <pre> 
138         * setDash(6);      // = setDashArray(new float[] {6})
139         * setDash(6, 4);   // = setDashArray(new float[] {6, 4})
140         * setDash();       // = setDashArray(null)
141         * </pre>
142         * @see BasicStroke
143         * @see BasicStroke#getDashArray()
144         * @param dashes a (possibly empty) sequence of dash lengths
145         */
146        public void setDash(double... dashes) {
147                if (dashes == null || dashes.length == 0) {
148                        this.dashArray = null;
149                }
150                else {
151                        this.dashArray = Matrix.toFloat(dashes);
152                }
153        }
154        
155        // -------------------------------------------------------------
156        
157        public Color getStrokeColor() {
158                return this.strokeColor;
159        }
160        
161        public Color getFillColor() {
162                return this.fillColor;
163        }
164
165        // -------------------------------------------------------------
166        
167        /**
168         * Returns a AWT {@link BasicStroke} instance for the current
169         * state of this stroke (with no color information).
170         * 
171         * @return a AWT {@link BasicStroke}
172         */
173        public BasicStroke getBasicStroke() {   // TODO: invoke once or only when parameters change?
174                return new BasicStroke(lineWidth, endCap, lineJoin, 
175                        miterLimit, dashArray, dashPhase);
176        }
177
178}
